source_title: Bogan Weekly News | Smore Newsletters for Education

Talawanda

Around Talawanda

summary: **Camp Invention** summer program is coming to Marshall Elementary School (3260 Oxford Millville Road, Oxford, OH) for students entering grades K-6th. The program runs **June 8-12, 2026** from **9:00 AM to 3:30 PM** daily. Cost is **$285** (before discounts), with various promo codes available (save $20-$40 with codes FUN20, FUN25, or TRILESSON). Payment plans available through 4/9/2026. Register at **invent.org/claxxv** or call **800-968-4332**. Sibling discounts are also available at INVENT.ORG/SIBLING.

Bogan

Around Bogan

zoom_out_map
            
Lost and Found
Our lost and found is filling up! Please encourage your student to visit the lost and found if they have misplaced a lunchbox or article of clothing. Any items not claimed by winter break will be donated.Also, please make sure your child's name is written on the tag so that we can ensure lost items get back to students. Thank you!

summary: The **lost and found is filling up** with lunchboxes and clothing. Students should check for their missing items, and **any unclaimed items will be donated after winter break**. Parents are asked to **label their child's belongings with their name** to help return lost items.

title: Food Resources Available for Families
source_title: Bogan Weekly News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
Social 

Work 

Spotlight

Social Work Spotlight
Please click the photo above for more Talawanda resources.

summary:
Due to uncertainty around SNAP benefits in November, multiple food resources are available to students and families:
- **Little Free Pantry** - Located outside main entrance at Bogan, restocked daily
- **Backpack Program** - Small food bags sent home with students every Thursday
- **Family Food Boxes** - Can be picked up or delivered within 24 hours
- **Community Pantries** - Additional resources linked in the image

For assistance accessing these resources, contact Emily, Bogan Social Worker at **513-273-3403** or **whitee@talawanda.org**.

title: Cold and Flu Season Guidelines
source_title: Bogan Weekly News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
Nurse's 

Notes

Nurse's Notes

Updated October 24th
Hi Bogan Families!Cold and flu season are officially here and I wanted to share with you the guidelines on when to keep your sick children at home. This chart touches on more than just cold and flu but is a good reminder to all when we need to stay home and when we are able to return back to school. Please be sure if your child is out sick to call and let our attendance line know they will not be at school. Also, if your child has a doctor's note for excused days, have your child drop that off to the front office.Please click the photo below for information from the CDC.

summary: Cold and flu season has arrived. **When to stay home from school:** fever of 100¬∞F or higher, frequent/continual coughing or difficulty breathing, diarrhea or vomiting, body rash with fever, active head lice, eye infection with discharge, or sore throat with congestion. **When to return:** fever-free for 24 hours without fever-reducing medication (ibuprofen or acetaminophen), mild/infrequent cough, tolerating food for 12+ hours, rash improvement, after first head lice treatment, or 24 hours after starting eye drops/ointment. For COVID-19 positive cases, return when fever-free for 24 hours without medication and symptoms are minimal/improving. Call the attendance line when your child is sick, and submit doctor's notes to the front office.

title: Tech Healthy Household Presentation Event
source_title: Bogan Weekly News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
Around 

Talawanda

Around Talawanda

summary: **Project Reboot and Talawanda School District present "Keys to Building a Tech Healthy Household"** on **Tuesday, November 18th from 6-7:30 PM at Talawanda High School**. This 60-minute presentation plus 30-minute Q&A will cover tech addiction and how to overcome it, discussing screen time with kids, and practical tips for maintaining balanced relationships with technology. Hosted by Dino Ambrosi, Founder of Project Reboot, who has spoken to over 30,000 students and parents and created a TEDx talk with over 2 million views. All attendees will receive actionable take-home resources and dinner table discussion guides. More info at https://projectreboot.school. Grant support provided by Greater Oxford Community Foundation.

title: Halloween Celebration and Costume Guidelines
source_title: Bogan Weekly News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
Halloween
We will celebrate Halloween at Bogan on Friday, October 31st. Costumes will be permitted with the following guidelines:1. No Costume Masks2. No Props3. Minimal Makeup4. Costumes must be worn to school. There will not be a ‚Äúchange time‚Äù. Please make sure that your child will be able to function comfortably throughout the day (bathroom needs, recess, school work, specials) while wearing his/her costume.Weather permitting, we will have a costume parade outside of the building at 9:30am. If your child is a car rider, you are welcome to pull around and park in our lot to wait for the parade to begin. If it is raining, parents will be permitted to line up in the gym and students will parade through.In addition, many of our classrooms are having Halloween parties. Many teachers are doing many different things, so please look for communication from your child's teacher for their specific plan.If you would not like your child to participate in the Halloween festivities, please let your child's teacher know.

summary: **Halloween will be celebrated on Friday, October 31st** with costumes permitted under specific guidelines: no masks, props, or minimal makeup only, and costumes must be worn to school all day. A **costume parade will take place at 9:30am** outside (weather permitting) or in the gym if raining, with parents welcome to attend. Classroom Halloween parties will also occur‚Äîcheck with your child's teacher for specific plans, and notify them if you prefer your child not participate.

title: 3rd Grade State Testing Information
source_title: Bogan Weekly News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
Around 

Bogan

Around Bogan

3rd Grade Testing
Our 3rd grade students will take the fall English Language Arts Ohio State Test this month. Students will test on Tuesday, October 21st and Thursday, October 23rd. We will complete makeups during this week as well. All testing will begin at 9:30am.If you are a 3rd grade parent, we would LOVE for you to write a letter or card of encouragement to your child that they will read before starting the test. If possible, please put the letters in an envelope because we would like for them to be a sweet surprise for our students!We have planned a (short) 3rd grade Pep Rally on Monday, October 20th for our students. The purpose of this pep rally is to build confidence and encouragement.Teachers are also taking time to explain to students what trying their best looks like when taking a test. For example, we encourage students to take their time and check their work. We would appreciate if you would also talk to your student about the importance of doing their best on the test. Students who do their best on the test will be invited to a 3rd grade Movie Party on Friday, October 24th!

summary: **3rd grade students will take the fall English Language Arts Ohio State Test** on Tuesday, October 21st and Thursday, October 23rd, beginning at 9:30am. Parents are encouraged to write letters of encouragement for their child to read before testing. A pep rally is scheduled for Monday, October 20th, and students who do their best will be invited to a movie party on Friday, October 24th. Key tips for testing success include: get plenty of rest, be on time, eat a good breakfast, relax and take a deep breath, and follow your teacher's directions.

title: Annual Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly
source_title: Bogan Weekly News | Smore Newsletters for Education

summary: The Annual Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly will be held on **Tuesday, November 11, 2025** at Talawanda High School (5301 University Park Blvd, Oxford, OH 45056). Breakfast begins at **7:30 AM** and the assembly starts at **9:00 AM**. All veterans and one guest are invited to attend. To RSVP, scan the QR code or email Mrs. Croucher at **croucherk@talawanda.org** with the veteran's full name, branch of service, and total number attending. The event is sponsored by BT/Talawanda FCCLA & THS.
